Comment: The baseline deficit is now $1.8 trillion. The Republicans want to cut taxes/revenue by $500 billion for each of the next 10 years. In exchange, the hardcore Freedom Caucus wants $500 billion in annual spending cuts. At BEST we’re stuck with $1.8 billion deficits going forward.  Here’s the bigger problem. The Republican Senate only wants $150 billion in annual spending cuts. The Republican House has already backed off $90 billion of proposed annual Medicaid cuts, so the entire Republican budget proposal is already up in smoke.  In the end (by the end of the year basically) they need a 10-year tax plan. In all likelihood, the deficit hawks in the House will all fold except for two (Spartz and Roy) and the Republican House and Senate will agree to something like $200 billion annual spending cuts with $300 billion of gimmicks giving the illusion that the new tax plan is deficit neutral all the while solidifying $2.1 trillion or greater annual deficits in perpetuity. And they’ll celebrate it as if they won the Super Bowl.
